title: Use the “Find My Mobile” Feature to Track Your Galaxy Device

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. Tap on the gear icon of the Settings app in the apps drawer to access it. You can also pull down the notification window and tap on the gear icon to directly open the Settings app. Find My Mobile is the most commonly known name for this feature, which has since been merged with SmartThings Find.

steps.title: Tap your account name at the top.
steps.content: Tap your account name at the top. This is your Samsung account. If you never signed into a Samsung account on your Galaxy phone or tablet, add or create one .

steps.title: Tap Find My Mobile.
steps.content: Tap Find My Mobile . It's near the bottom of the menu next to a small screen and magnifying glass icon.

steps.title: Tap Allow this phone to be found.
steps.content: Tap Allow this phone to be found . You can enable the other toggles as well, but those are optional. However, "Allow this phone to be found" must be enabled so you can track the Samsung online. If you ever need to locate your Samsung, go to https://smartthingsfind.samsung.com , log into your Samsung account, and select your device. You'll see on the map where it is and have options to Ring , Refresh , Lost mode , Track location , Erase data , and Extend battery life . [1] X Research source Use Track location if your Samsung is constantly moving so you're up-to-date on its location.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. Tap on the gear icon of the Settings app in the apps drawer to access it. You can also pull down the notification window and tap on the gear icon to directly open the Settings app. This is a useful method if you have a Samsung phone or tablet, but never created or added a Samsung account to it. As soon as you log into a Google account on your phone or tablet, Find My Device is automatically turned on.

steps.title: Find your Galaxy device at https://www.google.com/android/find/.
steps.content: Find your Galaxy device at https://www.google.com/android/find/ . Go to the Find My Device site, log in, and select your device. Once located, you'll be able to see the phone or tablet's location in a map view that links to Google Maps if you click or tap the location. You also have more options for the lost device, like Play sound , Secure device , and Factory reset device . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Can these services find my phone if my battery has died?
steps.content: Can these services find my phone if my battery has died? Using the "Find My" services from either Samsung or Google will show you the last location of the phone or tablet before it ran out of battery. This rule only changes if you have supported devices, like the Pixel 8. In that case, Google's Find My Device will be able to locate the phone for several hours after it's turned off. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Can these services find my phone even if it's not connected to the internet?
steps.content: Can these services find my phone even if it's not connected to the internet? Using the "Find My" services from either Samsung or Google will show you the last location of the phone or tablet before it lost internet connection.

steps.title: Will the "Play sound" options work if my phone is muted?
steps.content: Will the "Play sound" options work if my phone is muted? Yes, in both Google and Samsung's device locator software, the sound options will play a sound on your phone or cause the ringtone to sound even if the phone or tablet is muted or silent.

steps.title: How do I know if someone is tracking my location this way?
steps.content: How do I know if someone is tracking my location this way? When Google or Samsung pings your phone's/tablet's location, it will show a notification. You don't have to worry that someone is tracking you without your knowledge since the notification is easy to see and hear!
